Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge, referred to as “Danshen” in China or “Tanshen” in Japan, which is an important species in Salvia genus with great medicinal values
1 , was first recorded in Shennong Bencao Jing, the earliest famous extant monograph of traditional Chinese pharmacology in China
2 . The dry roots and rhizomes of S. miltiorrhiza, called Danshen, have been extensively used in the clinical treatments of many different diseases, such as coronary heart disease
3 , hyperlipidemia
4 , cerebrovascular disease
5 , Alzheimer’s disease
6 , hypertension
7 , cancer
8 and osteoporosis
9 .
